definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: The Console should indicate that both subscribers received a copy of the message.
sentences.chinese: 控制檯應該指示兩個訂戶均收到了該消息的複本。

sentences.english: He got a whole sackful of letters from listeners following the show.
sentences.chinese: 演出後他收到大量的聽衆來信。

sentences.english: This, it appears, is the legacy I have received and have now bequeathed to my own child.
sentences.chinese: 而這，正是我已收到並留給自己孩子的遺產。

sentences.english: A material handler in the downstream location is signaled to withdraw parts.
sentences.chinese: 位於下游的物料管理員收到領取零部件的信號。

sentences.english: Interference with the normal production of heme or globin leads to anemia.
sentences.chinese: 血紅素或球蛋白的正常產生收到干擾會導致貧血。

sentences.english: Today I receive salary RMB 0000 from Modim Fashion Corporation Ltd.
sentences.chinese: 今收到牧鼎服飾公司工資0000元整。

sentences.english: Concise, after receipt of the g frequently reply in turn good mood.
sentences.chinese: 簡潔收到克勤的回覆後，心情轉好。

sentences.english: I'm having so much fun with it!
sentences.chinese: 對我而言，在生日時收到祝語最有意義。

sentences.english: The admission notice he received from the university rejoiced his mother's heart.
sentences.chinese: 他收到的大學錄取通知書使他的母親心花怒放。

sentences.english: Although issuer gets right gold, need to assume the market to turn over aweather danger however.
sentences.chinese: 發行者雖然收到權利金，卻需要承擔市場反向風險。

sentences.english: After getting new email: waste 10 minutes aimlessly surfing the web.
sentences.chinese: 漫無目的的上上網，在收到一封信郵件後。

sentences.english: This was given us as a present on the occasion of our silver wedding.
sentences.chinese: 這是我們銀婚紀念時，收到的禮物。

sentences.english: Have you received the specifications as shown in our catalog?
sentences.chinese: 你們收到了按我方目次所列的產物規格了嗎？

sentences.english: I would like to receive from you a detailed report on current market conditions every month .
sentences.chinese: 我想每月收到你方一份具體確當前市場行情報告。

sentences.english: I didn't receive my white suitcase.
sentences.chinese: 我還沒有收到白色的皮箱。

sentences.english: Your clients and colleagues don't have time to engage fully with every email they get.
sentences.chinese: 你的客戶和同事沒時間仔細看完收到的每封電子郵件。

definition: to transmit/to dispatch/to issue (an official document or credential)
to issue (an order, decree etc)/to send out/to dispatch/to produce (a sound)/to let out (a laugh)
to reply/to recover/to return (to a previous condition)/Re: in reply to (email)
reception (of transmitted signal)/to receive/to accept/to admit/to take over (e.g. a factory)/to expropriate
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
